verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD to his anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I have holden, to subdue nations before him; and I will loose the loins of kings, to open before him the two leaved gates; and the gates shall not be shut;
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says to his anointed one, to Cyrus, whose right hand I have grasped to conquer nations ahead of him, to strip kings of their power, to throw open double doors before him so that no gate remains closed:

verses.kjv: I will go before thee, and make the crooked places straight: I will break in pieces the gates of brass, and cut in sunder the bars of iron:
verses.ct: "I will go ahead of you and level the uneven ground. I will shatter bronze gates and cut through iron bars.

verses.kjv: And I will give thee the treasures of darkness, and hidden riches of secret places, that thou mayest know that I, the LORD, which call thee by thy name, am the God of Israel.
verses.ct: I will hand you treasures stored in darkness and wealth hidden in secret places, so that you will recognize that I, the LORD, the God of Israel, am the one who calls you by name.

verses.kjv: For Jacob my servant’s sake, and Israel mine elect, I have even called thee by thy name: I have surnamed thee, though thou hast not known me.
verses.ct: For the sake of my servant Jacob, and Israel my chosen people, I called you by name and gave you a title of honor, even though you did not know me.

verses.kjv: I am the LORD, and there is none else, there is no God beside me: I girded thee, though thou hast not known me:
verses.ct: I am the LORD, and there is no other. There is no God apart from me. I equipped you for battle, even though you did not know me,

verses.kjv: That they may know from the rising of the sun, and from the west, that there is none beside me. I am the LORD, and there is none else.
verses.ct: so that everyone from east to west would know that there is no one besides me. I am the LORD, and there is no other.

verses.kjv: I form the light, and create darkness: I make peace, and create evil: I the LORD do all these things.
verses.ct: I form light and create darkness. I bring prosperity and create disaster. I, the LORD, do all these things."

verses.kjv: Drop down, ye heavens, from above, and let the skies pour down righteousness: let the earth open, and let them bring forth salvation, and let righteousness spring up together; I the LORD have created it.
verses.ct: "Rain down from above, you heavens, and let the clouds pour out righteousness. Let the earth open up so that salvation springs forth and righteousness grows alongside it. I, the LORD, have created it."

verses.kjv: Woe unto him that striveth with his Maker! Let the potsherd strive with the potsherds of the earth. Shall the clay say to him that fashioneth it, What makest thou? or thy work, He hath no hands?
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for anyone who argues with his Maker! You are just a broken piece of pottery among other broken pieces on the ground. Does the clay say to the one shaping it, "What are you making?" Does the thing that was made say, "He has no skill"?

verses.kjv: Woe unto him that saith unto his father, What begettest thou? or to the woman, What hast thou brought forth?
verses.ct: How terrible for the one who says to his father, "What kind of child are you fathering?" or to his mother, "What have you given birth to?"

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, the Holy One of Israel, and his Maker, Ask me of things to come concerning my sons, and concerning the work of my hands command ye me.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says, the Holy One of Israel and his Maker: "Are you going to question me about what is coming for my children? Are you going to give me orders about the work of my hands?

verses.kjv: I have made the earth, and created man upon it: I, even my hands, have stretched out the heavens, and all their host have I commanded.
verses.ct: I made the earth and created humanity on it. My own hands stretched out the heavens, and I directed all their stars.

verses.kjv: I have raised him up in righteousness, and I will direct all his ways: he shall build my city, and he shall let go my captives, not for price nor reward, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: I have raised Cyrus up for a righteous purpose, and I will make all his paths straight. He will rebuild my city and set my exiled people free — not for payment or reward," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, The labour of Egypt, and merchandise of Ethiopia and of the Sabeans, men of stature, shall come over unto thee, and they shall be thine: they shall come after thee; in chains they shall come over, and they shall fall down unto thee, they shall make supplication unto thee, saying, Surely God is in thee; and there is none else, there is no God.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "The products of Egypt, the goods of Ethiopia, and the tall Sabeans will all come over to you and belong to you. They will follow behind you, coming in chains. They will bow down before you and plead with you, saying, 'Surely God is with you, and there is no other — no other God at all.'"

verses.kjv: Verily thou art a God that hidest thyself, O God of Israel, the Saviour.
verses.ct: Truly, you are a God who conceals himself, O God of Israel, the Savior.

verses.kjv: They shall be ashamed, and also confounded, all of them: they shall go to confusion together that are makers of idols.
verses.ct: All the idol makers will be put to shame and disgraced. Together they will walk away humiliated.

verses.kjv: But Israel shall be saved in the LORD with an everlasting salvation: ye shall not be ashamed nor confounded world without end.
verses.ct: But Israel will be saved by the LORD with an eternal salvation. You will never be put to shame or disgraced for all of time.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD that created the heavens; God himself that formed the earth and made it; he hath established it, he created it not in vain, he formed it to be inhabited: I am the LORD; and there is none else.
verses.ct: For this is what the LORD says — the one who created the heavens, the God who shaped the earth and made it, who established it firmly. He did not create it to be empty but formed it to be lived in: "I am the LORD, and there is no other.

verses.kjv: I have not spoken in secret, in a dark place of the earth: I said not unto the seed of Jacob, Seek ye me in vain: I the LORD speak righteousness, I declare things that are right.
verses.ct: I have not spoken in secret or from some dark corner of the earth. I did not tell the descendants of Jacob, 'Search for me without purpose.' I, the LORD, speak what is right and declare what is true."

verses.kjv: Assemble yourselves and come; draw near together, ye that are escaped of the nations: they have no knowledge that set up the wood of their graven image, and pray unto a god that cannot save.
verses.ct: "Gather together and come! Draw near, all you survivors from the nations. Those who carry around their wooden idols and pray to gods that cannot save them have no understanding.

verses.kjv: Tell ye, and bring them near; yea, let them take counsel together: who hath declared this from ancient time? who hath told it from that time? have not I the LORD? and there is no God else beside me; a just God and a Saviour; there is none beside me.
verses.ct: Present your case and bring your evidence. Let them consult with each other. Who announced this long ago? Who predicted it back then? Wasn't it I, the LORD? There is no other God besides me — a righteous God and a Savior. There is no one apart from me.

verses.kjv: Look unto me, and be ye saved, all the ends of the earth: for I am God, and there is none else.
verses.ct: Turn to me and be saved, all you people across the earth, for I am God, and there is no other.

verses.kjv: I have sworn by myself, the word is gone out of my mouth in righteousness, and shall not return, That unto me every knee shall bow, every tongue shall swear.
verses.ct: I have made a solemn oath by myself — a word has gone out from my mouth in righteousness, and it will not be taken back — that every knee will bow before me, and every tongue will pledge allegiance to me.

verses.kjv: Surely, shall one say, in the LORD have I righteousness and strength: even to him shall men come; and all that are incensed against him shall be ashamed.
verses.ct: People will say about me, 'Only in the LORD can righteousness and strength be found.' All who have raged against him will come to him and be put to shame.

verses.kjv: In the LORD shall all the seed of Israel be justified, and shall glory.
verses.ct: In the LORD, all the descendants of Israel will be declared righteous and will celebrate his glory.
